fields.description: It seems that -SRCTREE-1486- still isn't implemented in the Windows app. When selecting multiple commits and right-clicking, all options are greyed out.
fields.summary: Cherry-picking multiple commits

fields.description:
When checking out a branch from Bitbucket Server, SourceTree does not recognize an existing bookmark/repo. SourceTree treats it like a clean clone of the branch

{quote}Anyone else seeing this one, very annoying, I need to browse to my repository each time.   I can't remember how I added the repository, if I originally cloned it, or added it as an existing directory on my disk.  This might be relevant I guess.   Whatever, once I have pointed it at the right place, it should remember that for future branch checkouts from Bitbucket Server.{quote}
fields.summary: When checking out a branch from Bitbucket Server, SourceTree does not recognize an existing bookmark/repo

fields.description:
{quote}Before you could use the /extract switch but now it looks like SourceTree uses the GitHub Squirrel installer.

While this may be fine for single users it is completely awful for controlled Enterprise environments.

Our users don't have permissions to execute unknown executables so they can't install SourceTree themselves. We have software deployment servers for this purpose.
{quote}
--STSP-6035
fields.summary: Include MSI installer for latest SourceTree release

fields.description:
Whenever I try to install these installers, I can just see a flash of screen and then a bug reporter comes up.  I'm forced to use very old version 0.9.2.3 which is working in my machine.

I have put up my responses in Atlassian Answers but no response yet. https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/46807193/answers/53053473
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.10.15.4 and beyond is not installing in Windows

fields.description:
I was able to successfully download sourceTree version: 1.10.20.1. Installation goes ok with out any issue but when you try to open sourcetree, nothing really happens. When i look at the log file, I see below error. Not really sure what is causing it or how to fix it.

ERROR [2017-02-27 11:17:22,879] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
at SourceTree.Configuration.UninstallerPreFlightCheck.FindVersionsRegistry()
at SourceTree.Configuration.UninstallerPreFlightCheck.Run()
at SourceTree.AppRoot.RunPreFlightChecks()
at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
ERROR [2017-02-27 11:17:35,677] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
at SourceTree.Configuration.UninstallerPreFlightCheck.FindVersionsRegistry()
at SourceTree.Configuration.UninstallerPreFlightCheck.Run()
at SourceTree.AppRoot.RunPreFlightChecks()
at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
fields.summary: Sourcetree unable to open on windows 7 professional

fields.description: Dragging and dropping a file within it's current staged/unstaged list causes it to move to the other list. This is extremely counter-intuitive and counter to all standard UX guidelines. Typically dragging a item and dropping it in it's original location results in no action, the exact opposite behavior here. This is highly important as there must be a way to cancel a drag and this also should be the behavior to ensure a short inadvertent drag caused by either user error or occasional mouse/touchpad strangeness (click can turn into drag dues to cpu usage between press and release) doesn't have unintended consequences.
fields.summary: Drag & Drop within same window should not cause stage/unstage

fields.description:
Right Clicking on a modified file, launches a Context menu. To cancel the context menu a left click is required. If the left click is on the original selected file, a 'drag' appears to happen causing an unintended state/unstage which if not caught could cause a introduce a major problem.

The bug itself may be addressed to strange drag in same window behavior which will be filed in another bug.
fields.summary: Right Click + Left Click On Item causes stage/unstage drag
"Labels" section is missing from commit info panel

fields.description: Normal rebase is OK.
fields.summary: Continue/Abort Rebase not enabled during interactive rebase

fields.description: Pressing the Delete button changes the button text to Restore, but there's no indication in the list of which commits have been deleted.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase: no indication of deleted commit
Ability to not use Git LFS Adapter without any popups

appear to have performance issues, but I'm not sure that if it's related to this persistent log file errors: {quote}ERROR [2017-02-26 10:33:21,772] [PriorityScheduler: ] [SourceTree.Analytics.Submission.Gas.GasAnalyticsSubmissionService+<>c] [b__15_1] - Unable to confirm status of GAS via HealthCheck Octokit.NotFoundException: 404 Not Found

Unable to download ST extras files behind web proxy

fields.description:
I try to finish a git-flow feature. But I cannot press the OK button as there is no feature to select. 

Maybe important background: I did not start this feature with Sourcetree but with GitKraken.

I attached a small video that shows my problem.
fields.summary: git-flow: cannot finish a feature

fields.description:
When removing one or more untracked files from within Unstaged view, SourceTree crashes.

The selected files are removed, but SourceTree has to be restarted.

Crash reported in Bugsplat, Row number: 54654
fields.summary: Removing Unstaged File crashes ST
git clone/fetch/pull failed with efrror: RPC failed; result=18, HTTP code = 200B

fields.description:
When invoking SourceTree from Start menu, an alert/error message appears:

---------------------------
 Pageant Error
 ---------------------------
 Pageant is already running
 ---------------------------
 OK 
 ---------------------------
fields.summary: Alert when starting: Pageant is already running

fields.description: If source code lines start with # character (like C preprocessor directive), difference highlights are sometimes incorrect - no red/green background, and + and - characters placed outside their column.
fields.summary: Incorrect diff display with # character

fields.description:
Hello,

I have downloaded the latest stable sourcetree(SourceTreeSetup-1.10.20.1) and the 2 beta version(SourceTreeSetup-2.0.7-beta-001). from your website and my antivirus discovered those as - "Win.Malware.Mischa-1". Please fix it, i won't disable my antivirus in order to use the software. The antivirus is "ClamAV".


[https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/49203a8657ce2b1f26141f6981464b3dd91045700faec1fd2733252ab05ea4db/analysis/\\|https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/49203a8657ce2b1f26141f6981464b3dd91045700faec1fd2733252ab05ea4db/analysis//] [https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/8bf3c8cb8e80657fb744ac7ae519e13ecd2e96d9f3487f6e4d9ebff00cba8d37/analysis/]
fields.summary: SourceTree installer detected as virus

fields.description:
We found a problem in mergettol with files having spaces on name:
the command that opens the mergetool didn't recognize files with spaces on name and then truncate the name which leads into a "file doesn't exists".

As the problem is on directory name, we changed the name of the directory, putting out the spaces. Then, when we try to perform a pull, a merge conflict appears but couldn't start because one of the files is on the directory with the space and the other in the directory without spaces.. which leads in merge command hangs and can't open the files.
fields.summary: Conflict in mergetool with files having spaces on name

fields.description:
I am unable to view my remote repositories or make any more pulls/pushes to the remote repositories in my companies GitHub.

Worked on previous versions with basic authentication with a personal access token. < 1.10

1.10 shows I connected with my 2FA enabled GitHub account made specifically for my company.
fields.summary: Cannot use GitHub Private Repository with 2FA

fields.description:
After a file change, SourceTree seems to take several seconds to figure out the proper file sort order and as its doing this, it keeps updating the order of files shown in the Unstaged files section.

 

The problem is that if I'm trying to look at a diff on a file or discard changes to a file or really any operation within the first few seconds I go back to SourceTree after some code changes, the sort order changes on me while I'm selecting files for some operation.  I've discarded changes on the wrong file a few times as a result of this, losing some work.

 

This is most easily reproduced by simply pressing F5 multiple times and watching the files all dance around in different orders every time.

 

The normal use case is to have a set of several pending changes to various files, then make one more change to one of the files and go back into SourceTree.  Left click on a file to view the diff and the sort order changes.

 

See attached screenshots illustrating the issue.
fields.summary: Unstaged Files sort order constantly changes

fields.description: On our remote repository we have a folder named "feature". Below this folder there are about 200 branches. When you press F5 In Sourcetree (refresh) 150 branches disappears. Now you see only the first 50 branches. Before the feature-folder is the symbol of a folded folder ">" (but the folder is expanded). Now you have to do the following steps with the feature-folder: open, close, open, close, open. Now you can see all branches in the folder - til the next refresh.
fields.summary: Remote branches folder in the sidebar does not show the full list of entries.

fields.description: Hi. Here's a good bug in this version (and perhaps in the latest, but it was this version that was being used). If you perform a merge and there are many conflicts - in the 'File Status' view the commit text pane takes up the whole panel and there is no way to select files to resolve conflicts!! I managed to get around this one, but it might cause someone a lot of grief :( .
fields.summary: For a large merge the comment box takes up the whole UI.

fields.description: On our remote repository we have a folder named "feature". Below this folder there are about 200 branches. When you press F5 In Sourcetree (refresh) 150 branches disappears. Now you see only the first 50 branches. Before the feature-folder is the symbol of a folded folder ">" (but the folder is expanded). Now you have to do the following steps with the feature-folder: open, close, open, close, open. Now you can see all branches in the folder - til the next refresh.
fields.summary: Remote branches folder in the sidebar does not show the full list of entries.

fields.description:
If you change the order of git repo tabs, then close and reopen source tree, the tab reverts to it's original ordering. Which appears to be the order you opened the git repo's.

I've had issues installing 1.10.19.1 as it doesn't appear to work on an offline network. I'll try again and see if bug goes away.

It's an annoying ui bug as i order based upon how i'm working and if it's not going to save the changes it shouldn't let you reorder them.
fields.summary: Tab Reorder on reopen

fields.description: If a bookmark item is already open in a tab it would be helpful if single select/click on the bookmark activates the corresponding open tab.  Double click will still activate the tab and also open if not already.
fields.summary: Allow single select on a bookmark to activate the corresponding open tab.  Double click will also activate and open if not already.
Unorthodox button text on "Please Restart" message box
Can't drag horizontal splitter in Log/History tab

fields.description:
{quote}
When you have cloned a repository and it fell behind after while, you can see an arrow with how many commits you are behind. See:

!image-2017-02-22-14-56-17-136.png|thumbnail! 

But when you have a repository with submodules, and one of the submodules is behind, there is no simple way to see this. You need to open the repository by clicking on the submodule. This isn't a problem with a few submodules, but we have some projects with 30 or more. See:

!image-2017-02-22-14-56-28-216.png|thumbnail! 
{quote}

There should be an easier way to see submodules' ahead/behind.
fields.summary: There should be an easier way to see submodules' ahead/behind.

fields.description:
For any Hunk which is both taller than the git compare window, and has one or more lines that are longer than the width, the horizontal scroll bar for this window will be created out of sight at the bottom of the hunk.

This means in some cases to see scroll horizontally to see a different section of a line you would need to scroll vertically to the bottom of the hunk, scroll horizontally (hope you scrolled the right amount) then scroll back up.

!image-2017-02-22-10-49-55-876.png!
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll for long hunks stuck to bottom of hunk not screen

fields.description: It would help if the cursor would automatically focus the search field when clicking the + (new tab) button. We could start typing immediately
fields.summary: [BETA] Focus cursor to search field in the "new tab" page

fields.description: Would be nice to be able to sort your bookmarks alphabetically on the windows version like you can on the MAC version.
fields.summary: Sort Bookmarks
Refreshing with staged file selected selects same file in unstaged list

fields.description: In the File Status tab, pressing F5 to refresh sometimes changes the file order in the staged/unstaged file lists. Occasionally some files disappear from the list and reappear on next refresh.
fields.summary: Refresh changes file order, sometimes hides files

fields.description:
The new online installer will try to download modules from the internet, which does not work if someone is behind a proxy server. It does not use system proxy settings or support manual proxy settings.

This means it is not usable inside company networks with proxy configuration.
fields.summary: Installer does not work behind a Proxy
Selecting unstaged file should deselect staged files.

fields.description:
When reviewing a branch's past commits, having one of the files open on the right panel in order to see the diffs.

Every other second, the panel updates, a spinner apears, and the diff panel is cleared.

Sometimes even the diff summary, and the commit basic info panel on the left get celared and I only see three white boxes.
fields.summary: Automatic refreshing of commit overview

fields.description:
When starting the 2.0 beta of SourceTree for Windows [the app is maximised but has its window chrome cut off:

!image-2017-02-16-19-03-10-061.png!

The maximise button is displayed but clicking on it takes no effect.

If I minimize the app and restore it again from the taskbar it is displayed maximised as I would expect it to be on initial launch:

!image-2017-02-16-19-04-40-745.png!
fields.summary: SourceTree starts in weird maximised but not maximised state

fields.description:
The 2.0 beta of SourceTree for Windows has added numbering to the start of stashes, as seen in the attached screenshot.

This looks rather awkward as general convention is for a space to follow a colon.

If the addition of the number is deliberate could a space please be added after the colon, and lowercasing the "On" wouldn't go amiss either , e.g. _1: on my-branch: my wip_

Alternatively if the addition of the numbers is not deliberate (personally I don't see what value it adds) could stash names be displayed as they were in the 1.x versions?
fields.summary: Awkward looking prefixes on stash names

fields.description:
{quote}just sending you complementary information that I received from Scooter SW
support:

"*The paths we are showing are the ones created and passed from
SourceTree/Git*.
*We also have /title1="var1" and /title2="var2" for overriding this text
with another parameter, but requires SourceTree/Git to provide the
variable/text to display.*

I do not believe SourceTree or Git currently expose this as a variable, but
you can test/confirm from the command line by loading:
bcompare.exe "c:\folder1" "c:\folder2" /title1="title for folder 1"
/title2="title 2 for folder 2"
"
{quote}
It will be best that SourceTree can include the commit hashes while calling diff tools such as Beyond Compare so that it will be easy for user to identify content's revision

 

--STSP-5621
fields.summary: Include commit hashes when calling external difftool (Beyond Compare)

fields.description:
2.0.8-beta-001

On launch, SourceTree checks the working directory for a .git directory. If the .git directory is present but invalid (eg empty) then SourceTree crashes.

The attached screenshot shows the error that appears just before SourceTree crashes. If I'm fast I can click OK before it crashes but the same error reappears and ultimately SourceTree crashes.

Obviously this is the user's fault for having an invalid .git directory but SourceTree should not crash.
fields.summary: Crash on startup if working directory is an invalid repo

fields.description:
My dev team is distributed between :
 * Bogota, Columbia ‎(UTC-5) ,
 * Puerto la Cruz, Venezuela ‎(UTC-4) , and
 * Houston, TX, USA ( UTC-6 )

We've noticed that commit times as viewed in SourceTree are different than what is shown in Bitbucket , as can be seen in attached screnshots

 
 * Commit "0ba1a07" recorded 23 hours ago by Developer  1  (located in UTC-5)
 * Commit "b1b4b21" recorded 22 hours by Developer 2(located in UTC-4)

But in the sourcetree screensnap, the order is incorrect:
 * Commit "b1b4b21" recorded at 16:08 by Developer 2 (located in UTC-4)
 * Commit "0ba1a07" recorded at 15:43 by Developer 1 (located in UTC-5)

So it's making for a confusing commit history as viewed thru Sourcetree
fields.summary: Code commits flow in SourceTree doesn't match Bitbucket flow

fields.description:
When I right click on a file with conflicts and select Resolve Conflicts | Launch External Merge Tool, the tool does not start. 
I have p4Merge configured as an external tool.
I see the BASE, LOCAL, REMOTE, and BACKUP files are created, but p4merge.exe process does not start.

Path to p4Merge is in the %PATH%. I can launch p4merge.exe from the command line from any directory.
fields.summary: External Merge Tool does not start - P4merge

fields.description:
See the attached screenshot. On line 474 you can see that two underscore characters are not rendering correctly in the inline diff view (just before .isUndefined), but they are rendering correctly on the lines immediately above that. The problem persists if I refresh the view, switch back and forth between different files, or restart SourceTree.

The problem does not occur when using either 'git diff' from the command line, or using DiffMerge.
fields.summary: Underscore character not always rendered in diff view

fields.description:
As a user I would like to be able to manage my local and origin tags so I can quickly determine which tags need to be published.

The current repository tree that include File status, branches, tags and remotes could benefit with more visual cues to help with the management of repository tags. This is particularly relevant for people who are new to DVCS tags and so will be experimenting with how to use them effectively.
fields.summary: Show a visual indicator of local vs origin tags

fields.description: If you select a submodule and are not at the tip of that branch then changes can be made and committed with no branch checked out.  It would be great it the commit button was disabled in this situation. I have had engineers lose their code changes. I am aware of how to fix it on the command line but want to avoid this orphaned commit situation all together.
fields.summary: Sourcetree allows detached head commit

fields.description:
Hi, I'm unable to Install and Start sourcetree; I've GIT installed already.

Following error I get: 

System.Net.WebException: The remote name could not be resolved: '[downloads.atlassian.com|http://downloads.atlassian.com/]'

Also It says: Unable to extract C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\PortableGcmSt.7z.

I checked the above file and I have a 0 kb file with that name.

Can you please help.
fields.summary: Not able to Install / Start sourcetree

fields.description: In Jira, I created a Branch which takes me to BitBucket, and I then click 'Check out in SourceTree'. SourceTree shows a dialog with the proposed new branch name, except that it is not the new branch name, but the branch I am currently in. When the branch is created, it does have the correct name.
fields.summary: When creating branch, wrong branch name appears

fields.description:
When you select "Uncommitted changes" in the Log / History view, the file list doesn't show up in the order selected.

Screenshot of initial file list - [https://www.screencast.com/t/0qgRiCggen6]

Screenshot of sorted file list - [https://www.screencast.com/t/OZZJIgqRz]
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes file list view not sorted correctly

fields.description:
When I start SourceTree, it comes up in the "No staging" view.

If I change to "Split view staging", quit, and restart, it's back to "No staging".
fields.summary: SourceTree always starts up in "No staging" view

fields.description:
hi,

I cannot install Sourcetree.

Unable to extract C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\PortableGcmSt.7z

System.Net.WebException: Unable to connect to the remote server
 System.Net.Sockets.SocketException: A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond 52.222.217.225:443

we get blocked by firewall.
fields.summary: PortableGcmSt.7z

fields.description:
Steps to repro are in the README.md file of the attached SourceTree_issue.zip file. I'll repeat most of it below. 

These are probably not minimal steps.  Should be able to eliminate git flow from the steps. It may be necessary for both tabs to be open.


 ### Steps to reproduce

Unzip this folder to a machine with Windows 7 SP2 and SourceTree 10.15.4.0.  Change to the root directory.
 
   * Run the batch file `setup.bat`.    
   * Open the project `repos\super` in SourceTree and cancel its bookmark.
   * Double-click on the submodule `sub` to open another tab and cancel its
 bookmark.  
   * Return to the `super `` tab.  
   * Switch to View \> File Status View, if not already there.  
   * Add a comment in the comment field. Uncheck Push changes.
   * Click on Commit in the lower right.  
   * In the Submodule Check dialog click on the Open button for `sub`.  
   * Add a comment in the comment field.  
   * Uncheck push and click Commit.
 
 I expect the commit to succeed or fail.  Instead the dialog freezes.

 

###Workaround

There is a workaround.  You can exit/kill Sourcetree and start again, and this time commit all changes in lower submodules before committing in upper modules.  Or maybe this very attractive feature works from the supermodule if the submodule tab was never opened in the session.  I didn't lose data or put the repos into a state that required time to analyze.  But I'm not sure whether some other scenarios with more levels of submodules would lose data.
fields.summary: Commit dialog freezes for submodule

fields.description: When I unstage a single hunk from file X in the Staged files list, then, for every file in the list below file X, the hunk window to the right of the Staged files list shows hunks from file X and not hunks from the currently selected file. This does not happen when browsing files above file X in the Staged files list. When I select a file in the Unstaged files list and go back to the Staged files list, the problem does not occur anymore. The problem occurs both when using keyboard arrows or mouse clicks for selecting files in the Staged files list.
fields.summary: Unstaging a single hunk corrupts hunks view for other files

fields.description: The only problem noticed so far is that it leaves lots of git processes in memory after it exits.  I have about 40 dormant git.exe processes hanging around.
fields.summary: Orphaned Git process left after shutdown

fields.description: When connecting SourceTree to GitHub during the initial setup, it asks for a lot of permissions that I really don't think it needs. For example, admin access to my SSH keys, webhooks, orgs and teams. Considering that SourceTree doesn't actually provide any features to administrate those, I don't see why it needs those permissions.
fields.summary: Review OAuth permissions requested

fields.description:
A couple of small problems I have ran into a couple of times now:

When running Sourcetree Fullscreen (Win7 64bit), it refuses to go back to windowed mode, and both times it's done this, it's laying things out slightly strangely, in that the Application toolbar text (File, Edit View etc.) is right up against the top of the screen, 

Double clicking an empty area of the titlebar doesn't maximize like all my other Windows Applications.  My expectation is that is should.

A bit more info on the windowing mode weirdness I am seeing.   If I exit Sourcetree with the application fullscreen, when I restart it, it starts "fullscreen+ mode", were the menu text is chopped off the top, and the windowed mode button does nothing.   If I minimize and maximize it fixes it. 

Interestingly, it does it on my main monitor, every time, very repeatable, but never does this on my secondary monitor.  Can anyone else reproduce this weirdness?
fields.summary: Problems running SourceTree in fullscreen mode.

fields.description: Just had my sourcetree crash three times trying to open a repository. If there is no update available to fix the crash I'm going to have to go back to the non-beta version. The Sourcetree beta program is interesting but crashing while trying to open a repository that used to work just fine indicates no testing has been done in my book.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashing when trying to open a repository

fields.description:
Wondering if anyone else has seen this.  I am not 100% sure it's happening, but something might be amiss. 

Often when I create and check out a branch from Bitbucket Server (using JIRA workflow), using the browser integration, it wants to clone a new repository, rather than use my existing repository, I have to switch th CheckOut Existing, and then browse for my directory. 

A few times now I have tried to create a pull request and it tells me there is no remote capable of this, and I have to go in and set my repository settings to be Stash (this should be called Bitbucket Server now!!) and enter my username.  I seem to have been doing this alot recently, and can't be 100% sure, but it feels like I have had to set this on repositories that I had previously set.
fields.summary: SourceTree forgets existing bookmarks when checking out from Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
Our mixed technical ability development team would find great usage from a GUI to manage Git LFS Fetch Includes and Excludes.

We're using SourceTree to manage our Unity 3D game project hosted on Bitbucket Cloud  The repo contains a mix of code, small text meta files and large data files managed by Git LFS, including *.wav, *.tif, *.psd, *.fbx, *.ma, *.mb. The team is composed of between 10-20 developers with a mix of technical ability, some are great coders, some are extremely talented artists but fairly tech illiterate.

We are now at the stage where we have a large amount of data to pull from Git LFS but not all of it is required by all developers. Splitting the repo doesn't make sense due to the difficulty some developers would have managing multiple repos. It does make sense to use git config lfs.fetch[include|exclude] patterns.

While most of the team are used to the concept of excluding files from checkout in Perfoce and SVN, it has always been with a GUI. Many of our developers are not comfortable using the Terminal or direct config file editing without guidance.

If the GUI also allowed for managing .gitignore and .gitattributes that would be a bonus.
fields.summary: SourceTree GUI for managing Git LFS Fetch Includes Excludes

fields.description:
{quote}The UI Text rendering stays sharp (which is great), however the icons look displaced.

Version: 2.0.7.1 on Windows 10.
{quote}
-- STSP-5975
fields.summary: Display issues after moving from HiDPI to LoDPI display

fields.description:
Dark theme in windows does not make SourceTree dark (as documented online that it should).

(I would prefer the ability to set my own theme colors to match my own dev. environ, but just the Windows Dark theme alone would help my eyes.  Look at GitKraken for a good example.)
fields.summary: Windows Dark Theme NOT updating SourceTree

fields.description: In either split or unified staging views, dragging a file anywhere within the same area toggled the staged status of the file. This feels very odd and causes files to inadvertently get staged/unstaged.
fields.summary: Dragging a file in the staging environment stages that file

fields.description:
Everytime I open the program the dialog "SpellChecker Error" appears.

Even if I click on "yes", the next time it appears again.
fields.summary: SpellChecker Error

fields.description: In split view staging, if several files are staged, the file order will change seemingly randomly whenever a file is staged or unstaged.
fields.summary: Staged file list reorders itself when staging/unstaging files

fields.description: In split view staging, you can select both a staged and unstaged file selected, the diff view will always show the staged file diff.
fields.summary: In split view, if a staged file is selected you cannot see the diff for an unstaged file

fields.description: Text files encoded with ANSI or UTF7 are not well displayed in the differences panel.
fields.summary: Bad character encoding

fields.description: When selecting a file and adding to staged (pressing space), then select a file in unstaged, right panel shows diff of both staged and unstaged changes. Also breaks committing slightly. You can commit but then it shows a commit status popup where you have to click on _show details_ then click close to dismiss. This is really annoying! Was stable the last few versions.
fields.summary: Weird staged/unstaged behaviour

fields.description: After committing some CLs, clicking commit withfiles in staging doesn't work. Tried Ctrl+Enter and that doesn't work. Have to restart app.
fields.summary: Committing sometimes doesn't work
When logging into SourceTree for the first time, a user gets a weird message (see description)

fields.description: When user does an initial login to SourceTree with Atlassian Account, there shouldn't be a need to elogin again to Bitbucket Cloud since they share the same credentials. It's basically logging in twice into the same system twice.
fields.summary: When user does an initial login to SourceTree with Atlassian Account, there shouldn't be a need to login again to Bitbucket Cloud since they share the same credentials.

fields.description:
The notification of the update should give an OK button. Cancel is not a valid response when uses are happy with the update and wish to continue:

!image-2017-02-09-13-52-48-483.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The notification of the update should give an OK button

fields.description:
Our team decided to try out the Windows Beta version of SourceTree.  You are correct that it is much faster.  However, we do not like that you removed the bookmarks repository sidebar.  That "space" you saved significantly reduced our teams effectiveness and efficiency with SourceTree.  The way our projects are organized they live across several repositories - so working on a single item in a Full-Stack environment may mean we need to work with several repositories.  It is very hard to do so with the "New Tab tab". 

As a suggestion - put it back as an option.  Even better would be a collapsible option so that you could have a side navigation panel that collapsed as needed but that auto-expanded when you mouse over it (and could be pinned if desired).  But even if that is too fancy, at least have an option that a user could turn it on or off manually.  Let the user decide how to best use the horizontal space.
fields.summary: Bring Back the Bookmarks repository side bar

fields.description:
Select Uncommitted changes

Select discard from above (icon)

press the discard changes button - asks to select a file

try select a file press the discard button - asks to select a file

This method does not appear to allow you to discard the file, have to resort to other methods
fields.summary: Discard changes not working as expected
UI is not refreshing to reflect repository changes
Commit view is not refreshing

fields.description:
When you drag a file in the changed files list / staged files, it doesn't matter where you drop it, it will always switch staged/unstaged state.... even if you drag it for only 1 pixel.

This is bad, i accidentaly stage/unstage files the whole time by clicking on them to read the changes.
fields.summary: Avoid staging/unstaging files by moving them 1 pixel in the same area

fields.description:
Never had issues with ST, but I'm on a fresh install of Win 10 x64 now, and ST is completely unusable. Upon start, it launches several "Git for Windows" processes and continuously starts grabbing RAM. I

ST always opens with a "repository" tab that is actually my name and it appears it's scanning my Windows user directory. The "unstaged files" window starts showing files from the "AppData" folder, so I think ST really is parsing my Win user directory which of course is giant. Closing that tab doesn't change anything though. Also, I set the setting to not open any tabs on startup, but it's happening nonetheless.

 

I could fix this eventually by going to the user directory and removing the .git folder in there. I can only assume ST created it, but wouldn't know why. Also, even if it was there before, why ST would detect and attempt to parse it.
fields.summary: ST tries scanning the Windows user directory, brings down the whole process

fields.description: On first setup, it asked for account and provided the ability to select a repo from BitBucket. I selected a repo that has spaces in it's name, as well as a folder on D:\ that has spaces. Screenshot of the error message is attached. Clicking "Cancel" just showed the error again, had to kill the app via Task Manager.
fields.summary: SourceTree "fatal: repo doesn't exist" loop on first setup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SourceTree 1.10.x fails to start in 32-bit Windows 7

h3. Environment
SourceTree 1.10.x - Windows 7 32-bit

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install SourceTree version 1.10.x
# Start SourceTree

h3. Expected Results
SourceTree application starts

h3. Actual Results
SourceTree fails to start.
In SourceTree log, the following exception appears:
{code}
ERROR [2017-01-31 16:59:58,798] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.NullReferenceException: Referencia a objeto no establecida como instancia de un objeto.
   en SourceTree.Configuration.UninstallerPreFlightCheck.FindVersionsRegistry()
   en SourceTree.Configuration.UninstallerPreFlightCheck.Run()
   en SourceTree.AppRoot.RunPreFlightChecks()
   en SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
   en SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
{code}

h3.Workaround
Install version 1.9.10 until the issue is fixed for versions 1.10.x
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.10.x fails to start in 32-bit Windows 7

fields.description:
When selecting a file in the Log/History window, right clicking and selecting "Open Selected Version":

!image-2017-02-07-21-14-38-925.png!

The following dialog box appears:

!image-2017-02-07-21-11-46-225.png!

Line: 29
Char: 5
Error: Object expected
Code: 800A138F
Source: Microsoft JScript runtime error
fields.summary: "Open Selected Version" causes Microsoft JScript runtime error

fields.description: When performing a Git Interactive Rebase, if you click on Edit Message, SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Crash when using Edit Message in Git Interactive Rebase

fields.description: Every time I want to create a pull request with SourceTree, I need to go to settings and edit/close my remotes. This isn't persisted even for one repository. After a restart of SourceTree I get this dialog again.
fields.summary: Persistent problem for creating pull requests

fields.description:
{quote}Since upgrading to 1.9.10.0 I can not create Github pull requests from my branch source tree.

When I right click on my branch (which I've got checked out) and choose 'Create pull request' I get the attached alert telling me I don't have remotes which have extended integration settings, but if I click the button I can see my remote does have extended integration settings.

I've attached screenshots showing the error message and my repository settings.
{quote}
– STSP-5795
fields.summary: Cannot create pull requests since upgrade to 1.9.10

fields.description:
Now, files cannot be opened by double-clicking it, instead we have to right-click the file and click "open":

https://www.screencast.com/t/W3zImjDW
fields.summary: Double-click on file not opening file.

fields.description:
If I attempt to discard changes to a file in a git repository while running SourceTree on a secondary monitor with different DPI settings to the primary monitor, then it doesn't show the confirmation dialog. You can see it attempt to create the confirmation dialog as a second window appears for it in the taskbar, however, mousing over it shows it completely blank (i.e. you don't get the normal preview of the window as you do for everything else).

It seems to be impossible to activate this confirmation dialog by selecting it in the taskbar or by alt-tabbing to it. Selecting the main SourceTree window is possible, but everything is disabled, presumably because it thinks that the modal confirmation dialog is visible. I am able to dismiss the confirmation dialog (but cannot confirm the discard operation) via closing it directly from the taskbar, which enables the main SourceTree application again.

This problem does not occur when I have SourceTree running on the primary display.

It also does not occur in either configuration in SourceTree for Windows v1.9.10.0.

Obviously this behaviour is annoying as it forces a change in my workflow, but it is hardly the end of the world.
fields.summary: Unable to discard changes to file when SourceTree running on secondary monitor with different DPI to primary monitor

fields.description: When performing a Git Interactive Rebase, if you click on Edit Message, SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Crash when using Edit Message in Git Interactive Rebase

fields.description:
All text is now rendered differently from before (version 1.9.10.0), and looks truly ugly on my screen. I suppose this is due to a more modern renderer, but to me it seems broken in windows 7.

At the very least, there should be an option to turn this new renderer off. I have provided screenshots for comparison.
fields.summary: New text renderer in version 2.0.7.10 yields ugly text in Win 7

fields.description: The current beta (2.0.7.1) does not honor the proxy settings while checking for new updates. The update process fails after timing out.
fields.summary: Updates do not honor proxy settings

fields.description:
Occasionally I'm seeing SourceTree miss modified files in its listed of staged & unstaged files in "File Status -> Working Copy" view. In this particular case it was obvious because I knew that I had modified 2 files but it was only showing one of them, but I suspect that this could be much more serious at other times if lots of files were modified, and then you accidentally only commit a subset of them.

Running the 'git status' command correctly returns the two modified files, and running 'git diff' correctly shows the changes in both files. Consequently this appears to be an issue with how SourceTree views the repository rather than with the repository itself. The repository in this case is quite small (2.3MB including the working copy).

The files in question were both modified several days ago, and I just opened SourceTree again this morning (i.e. in this case they were not modified while SourceTree was running).

Pressing Ctrl+R or F5 failed to refresh the view no matter where I set the focus prior to pressing those keys. However, using the View -> Refresh option from the menu did force the refresh to occur.

I have seen this a couple of times previously using this beta, but never when using either the previous version of SourceTree on Windows, or the current version of SourceTree on Mac. However, I'm not sure what specific behaviour causes this to occur (but am happy to help if you have specific things that you would like me to try).

There's 4 errors listed in my log file, but all appear to be dictionary related so it doesn't seem likely that they are related.
fields.summary: Some modified files are not shown in the file status view but are shown as modified by 'git status'
Dragging file within staged/unstaged list moves to the other list

fields.description:
Hi,

Basically, from my understanding, ST is supposed to fire a notification when a new push has arrived on repos, based on an interval.

I have a 5 mins interval, but it never works, only get notifications when I checkout the branch by myself, which is useless

I am not supposed to come back to the software before getting notification.

And it makes me miss some pushes too
fields.summary: Notification Not working as it should be

fields.description:
Version 2.0.7.1 beta (version isn't available in the "Affects Versions" dropdown)

See attached screenshot. The commit message and other details in that pane are not updating when selecting different commits from the search results.
fields.summary: SourceTree's Commit Detail pane doesn't update in Search tab

fields.description:
{quote}In Windows, in both v1.9.9.20 and v1.9.10.0, the Log/History list fails to load after a few minutes working in the app. It usually occurs after doing a Pull or Fetch.
{quote}
 
h3. Investigation Done
 * Performed Garbage Collection on all local repositories
 * Tried to run *Benchmark Repo Performance* on SourceTree 2.0.5 beta
 * Unable to run on one of the repositories and crashed when trying to viewing Log/History
 * Same symptoms happen on 2.0.7 beta. _The branch tree on one of the repos won't load, it just shows a spinner indefinitely, and if trying to switch to the Log/History view, the program crashes._ (Crash report #50566)
fields.summary: SourceTree fails to load the Log/History (STSP-5674)

fields.description:
This is super annoying!

1) I have multiple unstaged files.
 2) I select an unstaged file
 3) I click "Stage Selected"
 4) I immediately select another unstaged file
 5) Within a few seconds "Stage Selected" becomes disabled
 6) I have to unselect the selected unstaged file
 7) I have to reselect the unstaged file
 8) Now I can click "Stage Selected" again
fields.summary: Minor UI bug:

fields.description:
!constant_reconnect.png!

I am getting TCP reconnect messages every few seconds with SourceTree open. Destination is the git repo I use for work, and the problem is there is a firewall rule that blocks an IP address for 10 minutes if there are too many requests from that IP within one minute. I'm not 100% sure this TCP reconnect is what is tripping the limit, but I'm trying to rule out all possible causes. 

So, is there some way in SourceTree to disable the constant TCP reconnect?
fields.summary: Constant TCP reconnect every few seconds

fields.description:
My Windows is set to german language. When I go to "Tools->Options" and set "Language" to "Automatic" or "German" and restart SourceTree, the UI remains English. It should be German.
 I remember that this used to work like a year ago.
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores the selected language

fields.description: When viewing the tree, the dots or colored bubbles are centered between the comments instead of on one comment. See attached picture.
fields.summary: Dots not centered with comments

fields.description:
I downloaded "SourceTreeSetup-1.10.15.4.exe" from "https://www.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree". After double-clicking the application, an Atlassian logo appeared and nothing happened after that.

However, there is a "Atlassian" folder in the "Start Menu" and a "SourceTree" shortcut in the desktop. The shortcut is being pointed to "C:\Users\Syafiq\AppData\Local\SourceTree\Update.exe --processStart "SourceTree.exe". But nothing happened after double-clicking the shortcut.

Attached is the System Information of my machine. Hoping that you can help to solve the issue. Thank you~
fields.summary: I need to install SourceTree in my Windows 7 computer

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

-On windows start Source tree

-Click on Clone/New

-Paste a Git Repo URL on the destination then click on the Destination path Textbox

-The authenticate form will show up

-Fill in a WRONG username (In my cas it was an invalid email address)

-Provide a password and check remember

-Find out it was not the right email address by clicking on Login....

Now every time I try to clone the same repo the authenticate Form shows up with the WRONG email address grayed out. I can only provide a different password. I cannot change the Username!!!!

I try to restart Source tree, UNInstall Source tree, but all previous settings stay and the Invalid Email address is still there after a full Uninstall/Reinstall....

How can I remove this and provide another Username?

Thanks for the help
fields.summary: User name to login to remote cannot be changed once saved wrong
